name: Easter Lily
climate: Easter Lilies thrive in mild temperatures, ideally between 60-75Â°F.
They prefer a place where they can have some humidity to thrive.
Avoid extremely cold climates; they are not frost-tolerant plants.
Moderate climates are best; they do not do well in extreme heat.
sunlight: Easter Lilies prefer bright, indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
Direct, harsh sunlight can scorch the leaves of the Easter Lily.
A location with morning sun and afternoon shade works well.
Too much shade can result in leggy growth and fewer flowers.
watering: Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged for Easter Lilies.
Water thoroughly once the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
Avoid overhead watering to prevent fungal issues on flowers.
During their growing season, consistent moisture helps blooms.
soil: Well-draining soil is essential to prevent root rot in Easter Lilies.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH, around 6.0-7.0, is ideal for soil.
Loamy soil that retains moisture but drains excess water is good.
Adding organic matter can improve drainage and nutrient content.
toxic: Easter Lilies are toxic to cats and can cause kidney failure.
Symptoms of poisoning include vomiting, lethargy, and lack of appetite.
extra_care_tip: Remove spent flowers to encourage more blooms and prevent seed formation.
Provide support stakes if the stems become heavy and start to droop.
